title: (x) 'Orega' Rounded bold and strikethrough - Xcelsion {John Lyttle}
content:
Hi,

Could you please help me with the name of this font?

The logo is from around 2003, I think.

It's plain with no shadow and such, but the strikethrough is originally there(?).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202010443im_/http:/typophile.com/files/orega_4359.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [orega.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202010443/http:/typophile.com/files/orega_0.png) | 9.49 KB |
author: attach

comments.content:
I think you're onto something there, Ray. It looks like the oblique version of [Xcelsion](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202010443/http:/www.iconian.com/x.html).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202010443im_/http:/typophile.com/files/orega_ital_4672.jpg)

It could be the regular [Xcelsion](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202010443/http:/www.iconian.com/x.html) but skewed manually. The angle isn't quite as extreme as the italic version of the Xcelsion.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202010443im_/http:/typophile.com/files/orega_regular_4298.jpg)
